author: agnxsh
content:
i wanted to add an agenda for discussion:
- a discussion on if we want to activate peerdas at the fulu fork epoch (at the fork boundary, along with the higher max blob count), or have it activated some time later in fulu
- why i ask this - rn in the current spec we have `blob sidecar subnets` deprecated (ref: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/fulu/p2p-interface.md#deprecated-blob_sidecar_subnet_id), however at the same time we have a v3 of the req/resp domain for blob sidecars, which has `MAX_REQUEST_BLOB_SIDECARS_FULU` (ref: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/fulu/p2p-interface.md#blobsidecarsbyroot-v3), which is a further increased number than that of electra.

my confusion is, if, according to the spec, we don't have blob subnets i think we intend to mean there will be no blobs in the network at the `fulu` fork (?), then why do we have a v3 of the req/resp domain containing the blobs by root and range methods? can someone clarify this to me?

furthermore, if raising the max blob count and peerdas performance is more or less independent to each other, can we not trigger both the changes at `FULU_FORK_EPOCH`?

author: manunlp
content:
> a discussion on if we want to activate peerdas at the fulu fork epoch
During a previous breakout, we decided to activate peerDAS at the fulu fork epoch.

About gossip/RPC I have the same question.
I agree we should deprecate blob sidecars subnets.
IMO we should still keep blobs Req/Resp, at least at minimum during the retention window after the fulu fork, because a syncing peer may want to retrieve blobs **before** the Fulu fork epoch.

However, I don't see the point to introduce the V3 of of blobs Req/Resp. Prysm does not intend to use blobs Req/Resp at all after the Fulu fork epoch + retention window. And because blobs Req/Resp will be use for slots **before** Fulu, I don't think we need to introduce a V3.

Or maybe I miss something?

author: agnxsh
content:
> IMO we should still keep blobs Req/Resp, at least at minimum during the retention window after the fulu fork, because a syncing peer may want to retrieve blobs before the Fulu fork epoch.

author: agnxsh
content:
> one possible implication can be to deprecate blob subnets after peerdas is activated
but for this, in nimbus' gossipsub1.1 (we use that), one can't just simply subscribe and do nothing, effectively once fulu is activated we have to stay subscribed to both blob and column subnets, which may be sufficiently problematic.

the other point with the activate peerdas later into fulu plan is, there might be a chunk of time where we are storing both blobs and columns into our databases, because both their retention windows are effectively intersecting
